skill.name: edn-analyzer
skill.description: Deep EDN template analyzer for Logseq database graphs. Analyzes template structure, counts classes/properties, finds orphaned items, checks quality, and compares variants. Use when analyzing template files, finding issues, or comparing different template versions.
skill.summary: Deep EDN template analyzer for Logseq database graphs. Analyzes template structure, counts classes/p...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, no network access, and no file system modifications. The skill uses standard read-only tools (Read, Grep, Glob) to analyze EDN template files as intended.

content.user_title: Analyze Logseq EDN templates for structure and quality
content.value_statement: Large EDN template files are hard to understand and maintain. This skill provides deep analysis of Logseq database graph templates, finding issues like orphaned classes, duplicate IDs, and structural problems while offering actionable fixes.
actual_capabilities: Count classes and properties in EDN templates
Check for duplicate IDs and missing fields
Analyze property type and cardinality distribution
Map class hierarchies and inheritance chains
limitations: Cannot validate EDN syntax programmatically (uses pattern matching)
Cannot access files outside the specified project directory

use_cases.title: Quality assurance
use_cases.description: Find orphaned items, duplicates, and structural issues in Logseq template graphs before release

use_cases.title: Template comparison
use_cases.description: Compare full, CRM, and research template variants to understand differences and optimize for use case

use_cases.title: Module balance check
use_cases.description: Analyze module distribution to identify bloat and recommend reorganizations

prompt_templates.title: Basic template stats
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze build/logseq_db_Templates_full.edn and show me the basic statistics including total classes, properties, and file size

prompt_templates.title: Find orphaned items
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all orphaned classes in the full template that are missing :build/class-parent (excluding Thing and Agent)

prompt_templates.title: Compare variants
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the full and CRM templates showing class count, property count, size difference, and what modules each includes

prompt_templates.title: Property distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Show property type distribution by module including :default, :node, :date, :url, and :number types with counts and percentages

output: Top Hierarchies: Thing -> Person (36 props), Thing -> Organization (15 props)

best_practices: Run analysis before making changes to understand current structure
Use comparison feature to validate template variants before release
Fix orphaned items promptly to maintain class hierarchy integrity
anti_patterns: Making template changes without running structure analysis first
Ignoring orphaned classes that break inheritance chains
Using the full template when a specialized variant would suffice

faq.question: What file formats can this skill analyze?
faq.answer: Analyzes EDN files only, specifically Logseq database graph templates with :properties and :classes sections

faq.question: Can this skill modify my template files?
faq.answer: No. This skill is read-only and provides analysis only. It cannot write or modify any files.

faq.question: Does this skill work with the modular source directory?
faq.answer: Yes. It can analyze both monolithic templates in build/ and modular source files in source/*/

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads files you specify using standard read tools. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: How is this different from the module-health skill?
faq.answer: The edn-analyzer focuses on template content (classes, properties, issues). Module-health focuses on architectural balance between modules.

faq.question: What is the maximum template size this can analyze?
faq.answer: Handles large templates (15K+ lines) efficiently by reading and processing specific sections rather than loading everything at once
